metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7738 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: In util-linux before 2.32-rc1, bash-completion/umount allows local users to gain privileges by embedding shell commands in a mountpoint name, which is mishandled during a umount command (within Bash) by a different user, as demonstrated by logging in as root and entering umount followed by a tab character for autocompletion.

notes.Note: sbeattie> bash completion for umount moved from bash-completion to util-linux in util-linux 2.28-1 mdeslaur> script in xenial bash-completion package isn't vulnerable bash-completion package in bionic+ doesn't contain the umount helper

criterions.comment: bash-completion: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
util-linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
util-linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
